input_text:
Job Title: Senior IT Project Manager (CLDOPS-01) // US or GC // 100% On-Site Bethesda, MD // 1099

Location: Washington DC-Baltimore Area

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Information Technology, Project Management

Description:
About the OpportunityWe are only considering US Citizens, Permanent Residence (Green) Card holders, and EAD document holders for this position. We are unable to support any other sponsorship at this time.We are only considering candidates who currently reside within 35 minutes of postal code 20814No Third PartiesMust be able to provide proof of COVID-19 vaccination and boosterBase Pay : $135 per hour 1099; long term opportunityLocation: 100% on-site in Bethesda, Maryland; Red Line Bethesda Metro stopJob Id: CLDOPS-01Hours are M-F, 9am - 6pm with 1 hour lunch breakModern, light, and spacious work environmentFree parking, snacks, and gym membership for this roleExcellent opportunity for growth and advancement
Short DescriptionFor over 20 years, organizations have come to depend on Dantech for our IT expertise, quality, and customer service. We have helped startups, companies of all sizes, educational institutions, government agencies, associations, and international firms securely and efficiently transform and scale their IT, the way they work, and meet the demands of their customers.
We are looking for a Senior IT Project Manager to lead, organize, direct, and manage AWS Cloud Operations that support critical enterprise applications and processes that must operate in 24 x 7 x 365 environments. The ideal candidate will possess 7+ years of IT project management experience, 7+ years of SDLC, PMP Certification, Scrum Certification, excellent writing, speaking and presentation skills, and 3+ years of Cloud experience.
* Must currently reside within a daily commutable distance of Bethesda, MD to be considered* Must be a talented, tactful, eloquent communicator with superb listening skills* Must be obsessed with team delivery, quality deliverables, and customer service* Must be an advocate for rules, process, procedure, and governance* Must present documented Cloud project experience as a Technical Project Manager
Required Skills/Years of Experience:Bachelor’s degree in IT or related STEM fieldActive Project Management Professional Certification (PMI)Active Scrum Master Certification7+ years of experience as a Technical IT Project Manager7+ years of Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC)7+ years of experience with word processing software (MS Word or Google Docs)7+ years of experience with spreadsheet software (MS Excel or Google Sheets)5+ years of Cloud project experience in a large organization5+ years of participating in Agile Scrum ceremonies and writing stories5+ years of experience with presentation software (MS Powerpoint or Google Slides)5+ years of planning and managing mission critical projects/programs5+ years of conducting analysis and requirements gathering5+ years of using JIRA Agile Scrum boards4+ years of weekly status reporting4+ years of using project management software to plan and track projects3+ years of managing Cloud projects2+ years of conducting virtual meetings (e.g., MS Teams, AWS Chime, etc.)2+ years of managing projects in production environments1+ years of publishing and maintaining artifacts on Confluence1+ years of presenting to Technology Leadership
Desired Skills/Years of Experience:Active Cloud certificationActive ITIL certification3+ years of hands on development experience3+ years of hands-on AWS Cloud services (Console or CLI) experience1+ years of utilizing ticketing and/or ITSM solutions (e.g., ServiceNow)
Complete DescriptionWe are looking for a Senior IT Project Manager to lead, organize, direct, and manage the critical projects that support essential applications and processes that must operate in 24 x 7 x 365 environments. The ideal candidate will possess 7+ years of IT project management experience, 7+ years of SDLC, PMP Certification, Scrum Certification, excellent writing, speaking and presentation skills, and 3+ years of Cloud experience.
The Senior IT Project Manager will be tasked to:Become a highly valued, contributing member of the Dantech TeamBe courteous, kind, constructive, eager to learn, reliable, and professional at all timesAdhere to all Dantech policies and protocolsBe obsessed with quality and delivery on assigned projectsBe pragmatic, diplomatic and resourceful, with the ability to adapt quickly to different situations and personalitiesLearn quickly and document/update documentation accordinglyReport directly to the Client Engagement LeadExecute on the technical direction and blueprint provided by the Principal ArchitectBe highly communicative and take direction from Senior LeadershipEvaluate complex scenarios using multiple sources of informationManage and appropriately escalate: delivery impediments, risks, issues, and changes associated to solution development initiativesInteract with all staff levels, internally and externallyTrack and monitor project deliverablesDesign and implement processes to monitor and control resources, budget, risks and value to project goals and objectives.Establish, plan, and execute major milestone reviews and decision gates to ensure project completion.Employ excellent verbal and written communication skills and have the ability to interact professionally with a diverse group technical and non-technical audiencesEffectively manage scope throughout the project duration.Maintain accurate project schedules, financial burn rates, change management, project plans, and status reports.Convey a high level of understanding in the areas of operational resilience and scaleWill resolve conflicts by demonstrating leadership and appropriate decision-making competencies.Understand, track and articulate issues / risks / action items; work with responsible owners to address the items on a timely basis; and update the appropriate stakeholders as needed.Complete assigned training and obtain certifications as directed in a timely mannerSupport internal projects as well as external projectsThink critically and demonstrate a can-do attitude with a high level of initiative and an openness to feedbackComplete additional professional development opportunitiesSupport internal projects and office functions
Hiring ExpectationsWe are only considering US Citizens, Permanent Residence (Green) Card holders, EAD and document holders for this position. We are unable to support any other sponsorship at this time.No Third PartiesExpect technical interview screening(s)Expect an in-person F2F interviewBackground check and credit check will be required
About DantechDantech Corporation, Inc. is a Certified Business Enterprise (CBE) in the District of Columbia and a federally recognized Woman Owned Small Business (WOSB). The company has a history of technology, innovation and transformation since its launch in 1999. As an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer, all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, protected veteran status, or disability status. For more information, please see: www.dantechcorp.com.

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level

output_json.title: Senior IT Project Manager
output_json.summary: Lead, organize, direct, and manage AWS Cloud Operations supporting critical enterprise applications and processes in 24x7x365 environments.
preferred_degrees: Bachelor’s degree in IT or related STEM field
required_skills: 7+ years of experience as a Technical IT Project Manager
7+ years of Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC)
7+ years of experience with word processing software (MS Word or Google Docs)
7+ years of experience with spreadsheet software (MS Excel or Google Sheets)
5+ years of Cloud project experience in a large organization
5+ years of participating in Agile Scrum ceremonies and writing stories
5+ years of experience with presentation software (MS Powerpoint or Google Slides)
5+ years of planning and managing mission critical projects/programs
5+ years of conducting analysis and requirements gathering
4+ years of using project management software to plan and track projects
2+ years of managing projects in production environments
1+ years of publishing and maintaining artifacts on Confluence
1+ years of presenting to Technology Leadership
optional_skills: 3+ years of hands on development experience
3+ years of hands-on AWS Cloud services (Console or CLI) experience
1+ years of utilizing ticketing and/or ITSM solutions (e.g., ServiceNow)
soft_skills: Obsessed with team delivery, quality deliverables, and customer service
Advocate for rules, process, procedure, and governance
Documented Cloud project experience as a Technical Project Manager
job_responsibilities: Become a highly valued, contributing member of the Dantech Team
Adhere to all Dantech policies and protocols
Be courteous, kind, constructive, eager to learn, reliable, and professional at all times
Be obsessed with quality and delivery on assigned projects
Be pragmatic, diplomatic and resourceful, with the ability to adapt quickly to different situations and personalities
Learn quickly and document/update documentation accordingly
Report directly to the Client Engagement Lead
Execute on the technical direction and blueprint provided by the Principal Architect
Be highly communicative and take direction from Senior Leadership
Evaluate complex scenarios using multiple sources of information
Manage and appropriately escalate: delivery impediments, risks, issues, and changes associated to solution development initiatives
Interact with all staff levels, internally and externally
Track and monitor project deliverables
Design and implement processes to monitor and control resources, budget, risks and value to project goals and objectives
Establish, plan, and execute major milestone reviews and decision gates to ensure project completion
Employ excellent verbal and written communication skills and have the ability to interact professionally with a diverse group technical and non-technical audiences
Effectively manage scope throughout the project duration
Maintain accurate project schedules, financial burn rates, change management, project plans, and status reports
Convey a high level of understanding in the areas of operational resilience and scale
Resolve conflicts by demonstrating leadership and appropriate decision-making competencies
Understand, track and articulate issues / risks / action items; work with responsible owners to address the items on a timely basis; and update the appropriate stakeholders as needed
Complete assigned training and obtain certifications as directed in a timely manner
Support internal projects as well as external projects
Think critically and demonstrate a can-do attitude with a high level of initiative and an openness to feedback
Complete additional professional development opportunities
Support internal projects and office functions
benefits: Modern, light, and spacious work environment
output_json.company_information: Dantech Corporation, Inc. is a Certified Business Enterprise (CBE) in the District of Columbia and a federally recognized Woman Owned Small Business (WOSB).
output_json.equal_opportunity_policy: As an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer, all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, protected veteran status, or disability status.

other.content: We are only considering US Citizens, Permanent Residence (Green) Card holders, EAD and document holders for this position. We are unable to support any other sponsorship at this time. No Third Parties. Expect technical interview screening(s). Expect an in-person F2F interview. Background check and credit check will be required.
